questions.prompt: In BG 9.1, what does Krishna describe as the most confidential knowledge?
choices: The most secret knowledge; free from all doubts; this science is eternal
questions.feedback: This knowledge is the most profound and transformative of all teachings.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.2, what are the benefits of this knowledge?
choices: Free from all sin; sustains virtue; one attains eternal peace
questions.feedback: This knowledge purifies completely and grants eternal liberation.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.3, what happens to those who do not practice this yoga?
choices: They continue in the cycle of birth and death; they remain fallen
questions.feedback: Ignoring this path perpetuates material bondage and suffering.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.4 teach about Krishna's form?
choices: Though I am unborn, eternal, all-pervading, I appear in bodily form
questions.feedback: Krishna's manifestation in a body is beyond material laws.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.5, how does everything depend on Krishna?
choices: All beings rest on me as pearls on a thread
questions.feedback: Krishna sustains all creation like a thread holds pearls together.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.6, what cosmic elements rest upon Krishna?
choices: All elements, air, sky, planets, stars rest within me
questions.feedback: The entire cosmos is manifested within Krishna's potency.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.7 teach about creation and the Supreme?
choices: All things are created from me; all returns to me; I am the beginning and end
questions.feedback: Krishna is the source, sustainer, and ultimate destination of all.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.8, what is the attitude of those bewildered by illusion?
choices: They do not recognize my supreme nature and think I am mortal
questions.feedback: Ignorance of Krishna's transcendental nature is the root of delusion.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.9, what is the relationship between those attached to material nature and Krishna?
choices: Their intelligence is diverted; I am not visible to foolish persons
questions.feedback: Those lost in materialism cannot perceive Krishna's true nature.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.10 teach about the responsibility of maintaining creation?
choices: I maintain all creation; out of compassion, I support all beings
questions.feedback: Krishna's loving care sustains the entire cosmos moment by moment.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.11, what do those who only have faith in material nature achieve?
choices: Only temporary fruits; they miss the eternal blessing
questions.feedback: Limited faith produces limited and temporary results.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.12, what is the consequence of great effort in material pursuits?
choices: Labor and fruit are wasted on those who lack true purpose
questions.feedback: Work without spiritual direction ultimately yields no lasting benefit.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.13 teach about those who are not attached to worldly success?
choices: They are freed from bondage; they reach me without difficulty
questions.feedback: Detachment from results liberates one and brings direct perception of the Divine.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.14, what are the qualities of a devoted soul?
choices: Always engaged in remembrance; devoted mind; surrendered intelligence
questions.feedback: The true devotee is constantly absorbed in Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.15, what do some do to attain Krishna?
choices: Others engage in the knowledge of non-duality; they know all beings as one
questions.feedback: Some approach Krishna through non-dual knowledge of unity.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.16 teach about those who perform sacrifices and rituals?
choices: Those who offer sacrifices come to me; they receive benefits
questions.feedback: Proper ritual, when offered with faith, brings divine grace.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.17, what is Krishna's role in rituals and results?
choices: I am the recipient and the enjoyer of all sacrifices
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate beneficiary and giver of all fruits.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.18, what happens to those who worship Krishna?
choices: They reach me through devotion; they become mine
questions.feedback: Those devoted to Krishna are assured of eternal relationship with Him.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.19 teach about the path of different devotees?
choices: Those performing duties for me reach me through many varied paths
questions.feedback: Krishna accepts devotion expressed through many different means.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.20, what is promised to those who follow scriptural laws?
choices: They go to the celestial planets and enjoy; then they return
questions.feedback: Ritual and merit lead to heavenly pleasures, but these are temporary.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.21, what is the duration of stay in the celestial realms?
choices: They stay for as long as their merit lasts, then return
questions.feedback: Even heavenly rewards are temporary and eventually lead back to material struggle.

questions.prompt: What does BG 9.22 teach about those who remember Krishna constantly?
choices: I supply their needs and preserve their possessions
questions.feedback: Krishna personally cares for those devoted to remembering Him.

questions.prompt: According to BG 9.23, what is promised to those who worship other deities with exclusive faith?
choices: Their faith becomes firm, but they obtain temporary benefits and must return to material struggle
questions.feedback: Even exclusive worship of lesser deities leads only to temporary satisfaction.

questions.prompt: In BG 9.24, what kind of worship yields eternal results?
choices: Worship performed for me, with faith, offering all to me
questions.feedback: Exclusive devotion to Krishna, offered with pure intention, grants eternal benefit.

questions.prompt: What is the main message of Chapter 9's conclusion?
choices: Know me truly; surrender to me; become my dear friend and devotee
questions.feedback: Perfect knowledge culminates in exclusive devotion and intimate relationship with Krishna.
